question: 漬ける
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>pickle</kanji> or <kanji>soak</kanji>, so the verb version is <vocabulary>to pickle</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to soak</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading.  You learned this reading with the kanji. Good for you!
